issue.title: www.macrumors.com
issue.body:
### Issue URL (Incorrect Blocking) [https://www.macrumors.com/](https://adguardteam.github.io/AnonymousRedirect/redirect.html?url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.macrumors.com%2F) ### Comment > Hi. This is a new issue I haven't had until today with MacRumors. When I open the web, no images are shown. If I close Safari and open it again, the images remain lost. If I disable AdGuard, all the content from the web page returns. There must be something you or the MacRumors developers have changed that prevents the pics to be shown. Please, investigate it. Thank you. Best. Antonio ### Screenshots
Screenshot 1 ![Screenshot 1](https://cdn.adguardcdn.com/sitereports/9kel6q8wu6g4s044g4wksgkkoocow0sazpwaj7cu94.png?nc=1)
Screenshot 1 with AdGuard disabled ![Screenshot 1](https://cdn.adguardcdn.com/sitereports/dzo9a8ju568sk0s4s00owok4w0o8c8o8z6ldsbkv84.png?nc=1)
### System configuration Information | Value --- | --- AdGuard product: | AdGuard Mini for Mac v2.0.3.928 System version: | `MacOS 26.2 (Compilación 25C56)` Browser: | Safari License type: | free Filters: | Ad blocking:
AdGuard Base,
AdGuard Mobile Ads

Privacy:
AdGuard Tracking Protection

Social widgets:
AdGuard Social Media

Annoyances:
AdGuard Cookie Notices,
AdGuard Popups,
AdGuard Mobile App Banners,
AdGuard Other Annoyances,
AdGuard Widgets

Language-specific:
AdGuard Spanish/Portuguese Filters last update: | December 13, 2025 at 00:51 Other extensions used: | `Ninguna`

This is a new issue I haven't had until today with MacRumors. When I open the web, no images are shown. If I close Safari and open it again, the images remain lost.
